alert.note: Alert for Calhoun; Dougherty; Lee; Randolph; Terrell (Georgia) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued April 03 at 11:52AM EDT by NWS Tallahassee
info.description: ...Strong thunderstorms will impact portions of Dougherty, eastern Randolph, Lee, Calhoun and Terrell Counties in southwestern Georgia through 1230 PM EDT... At 1152 AM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking strong thunderstorms along a line extending from 7 miles northeast of Shellman to near Dawson to near Morgan. Movement was east at 55 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph and pea size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Morgan, Albany, Dawson, Leesburg, Putney, Arlington, Shellman, Leary, Smithville, East Albany, Marine Corps Logistics Base, Turner City, Walker, Sasser, Bronwood, Parrott, Stocks, Radium Springs, Dawson Municipal A/P and Chambliss. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with these storms and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways. Frequent cloud to ground lightning is occurring with these storms. Lightning can strike 10 miles away from a thunderstorm. Seek a safe shelter inside a building or vehicle. A Tornado Watch remains in effect until 500 PM EDT for south central and southwestern Georgia.
